name: 曾乙文
objective:
1990 年起，科技的快速變化讓生活更加便利，然而，在物質世界中，這種便利需要與思想的提升相配合。因此，激進設計（Radical Design）、批判性設計（Critical Design）、推測設計（Speculative Design）、論述設計（Discursive Design）與設計幻象（Design Fiction）等開始陸續興起。這些設計作為獨立話語權的機制，將意識與思想透過概念設計的形式傳遞出來，成為思想傳播的媒介管道，並成為當代設計在思想上的特殊指標。這類概念設計在實踐過程中，以當下的社會議題（STEEP）為探討和解決的對象，從社會（Society）、科技（Technology）、經濟（Economy）、環境（Environment）、政治（Politics）等方面尋找不同時代下的潛在發展信號，並應用哲學、科學、史學等跨領域的交叉學科知識，來進行設計學的思想實驗。本課程以推測設計為背景，主要以過去、現在、未來進行分類，並透過前瞻科技段來解決問題，必然會與不同科系的交流和咨詢相結合，整合設計學與未來學，創建在未來趨勢與科技變化下需要提升和進步的意識形態的新視野。

Since 1990, the rapid changes in technology have made life more convenient. However, convenience in the material world requires some enhancement in thought. As a result, Radical Design, Critical Design, Speculative Design, Discursive Design, and Design Fiction have gradually emerged, using design as a mechanism of independent discourse to convey awareness and thought through conceptual design. This has made design a special indicator of contemporary thought. In practice, these types of conceptual designs explore and address current social issues (STEEP) by identifying potential development signals from Society, Technology, Economy, Environment, and Politics. They also apply interdisciplinary knowledge from philosophy, science, history, and other fields to conduct thought experiments in design. This course uses speculative design as its background, categorizing it into past, present, and future, and solving problems through forward-looking technology. It necessarily involves exchanges and consultations with different disciplines, integrating design and futures studies to create new ideological perspectives that need to be enhanced and advanced under future trends and technological changes.

name: 楊宙航
objective:
以傳授設計原理、平面及立體設計觀念、美的形式原理、平面及立體的構成練習、對各種視覺媒材特性的應用經驗以及造形與色彩的研究達到對媒體設計感覺的養成，並提高計畫性創造能力，是發展實用性及機能性以前之媒體設計訓練的基礎。
This course aims to develop the ability of students to meet specific sensory needs through the creation of abstract visual order in the form of two-dimension and three-dimension. The visual organization of design elements including line, plane, volume, and the analysis of their abstract relationships and principles of order are studied.
